text.section:
A packer or distributor who is required to pay a fee under this subtitle shall submit to the Secretary:
A quarterly report showing the number of dozens of shell eggs sold or delivered in Maryland to any retailer, food service facility, or consumer; and
At the time that the quarterly report is due, an inspection fee at a rate of 8 cents for each 30-dozen case of shell eggs sold or delivered in Maryland.

section.section: If the report is not filed and the required inspection fee is not paid within 30 days after the end of the quarterly period, a collection fee shall be assessed against the packer or distributor.

The amount of the collection fee shall be the greater of:
10 percent of the inspection fee due and unpaid; or
$100.
The amount of collection fee due is a debt and may be the basis of a judgment in a civil action against the packer or distributor.
